review_text: I had a wonderful stay in this apartment. The kitchen/living room area was great. The kitchen was very well appointed including a coffee grinder and machine that makes espresso from pods which were supplied. Internet was screaming fast (like 500 Mbit both up and down). Had a Roku TV in the living room and in the bedroom. The owner is the most responsive AirBnB owner that I've rented from. The bathroom has a very small sink. If my wife was with me, this would have been more difficult to deal with than I'd like. They offer parking for $10/day which is needed if you can't get out of the street parking every day before a ticket would be issued. The parking is in a 1-car garage in an open area of 1-car garages for the building. You get in with a key they provide in a lock-box. There isn't an electric garage door opener which would have made the parking experience better. All in all, a very nice place to stay, in an excellent location.

Kay is an excellent host, and I had a fantastic stay. There are three things in particular that made this a 5-star visit:
1. Great Airstream
Airstreams are classic…but can be hit or miss. This is an absolute hit. The trailer is new with modern appointments like multiple TVs, a huge bathroom, and other conveniences. It was perfectly clean and cozy. And to top it off, the hot tub outside offers a great way to relax after a day of skiing.
2. Perfect location
Are you in SLC to ski? The Airstream is half a block from the 972 bus stop, which services Brighton and Solitude. Not only that, but since you’ll get on the bus before two of the big park-and-rides, you’re sure to get a seat.
3. Kay’s friendliness and responsiveness
Without question, Kay is one of the nicest and most responsive Airbnb hosts I’ve ever met. For instance, when a space heater shorted out, she had a replacement within the hour.
This was an all-around perfect visit. I’ll be back for sure.

We were told we could park our trailer in the backyard but then we’re requested to just park in front of the house and no assistance was given or offered to park the trailer. We were assured it was a safe neighborhood but many of the houses had bars on the windows and we did not feel comfortable leaving all our possessions out front and upon driving around it didn’t seem it was ever even possible to get to the backyard to park it so we were lied to get the room filled. There was a lot of noise coming from the upstairs and my husband is a disabled veteran with PTSD so it made him uncomfortable to hear all the stomping around, to the point he could not sleep. The beds were not touching the wall and my daughter tried to sit back on the bed and almost fell. We could hear talking upstairs from several people and we didn’t feel like there was any privacy for us to speak over a whisper without being heard by those upstairs. We tried to shut the door to minimize the noise but then there was an unpleasant noise upon doing so, like a whistling wind noise as the air struggled to circulate. We also ended up taking freezing cold showers, probably because of the several people staying upstairs, which is terrible for my husbands injured back. The tub stopper did not work so we couldn’t bathe our daughter. Debora’s husband was irritated and made a comment about my husband going in and out when we were packing up the car and we were doing so an hour and a half before quiet time. Someone also ran down to lock him out one of the times he went outside then lied and said they were making sure it was unlocked for him. The lack of transition strip to the bathroom is a hazard and should be fixed immediately, especially when children are allowed in the rental. My daughter almost busted her face open falling on it, had I not been behind her to catch her, she would have gotten seriously hurt. This place is newly remodeled, but it wasn’t done professionally, which would be fine except for the hazards and lack of privacy. This rental is awkward and cramped, besides the kitchen area which is oversized compared to the rest.
